title: 2 wounded in Trenton in weekend shootings
content:
TRENTON -- Trenton police are investigating two weekend shootings that wounded a 26-year-old man and a 17-year-old girl.
The first shooting occurred just before 6 p.m. Saturday on the 400 block of Cleveland Avenue, Lt. Stephen Varn said. Police responded after receiving calls about shots fired and found the 26-year-old inside a house.
He was taken to Capital Health Regional Medical Center with gunshot wounds to his left arm, left side of his back and armpit, Varn said. He was admitted for observation.
He told police he was sitting in front of a house when he heard several gunshots and realized he had been hit when he got up to run inside.
Varn did not know if he was with anyone else.
The second shooting occurred 24 hours later on the corner of Stuyvesant and Hoffman avenues. A 17-year-old girl was standing near a bus stop when she heard several gunshots, Varn said. She began running and realized she had been struck. She continued to the 100 block of Oakland Avenue, where she had a family member call 911.
She was taken to the hospital with a graze wound to her left leg and was treated and released, Varn said.
The Shooting Response Team is continuing to investigate both shootings. Police have not yet determined suspects or motives in either case.
